pages.title: ⤝ Queen of Swords ⤝
pages.text: Queen of the Thrones of Air$(br)       ∇ Water of $(m)∆$() Air

A crowned woman sits on her stone throne. Her right hand holds a sword pointed to the sky, the left hand is extended, perhaps to reach for another.$(br)  Lost in thought, she appears perhaps gloomy and gentle, her weapon notwithstanding.$(br)  The slow moving clouds low on the horizon stand for the ever changing nature of new ideas and enterprises.$(br)  The sense of separation and awe surrounds this Queen, who appears dim yet powerful, at the center of the world.

Her distant mind reaches below the messy realities of nature to the pure dualities underlying existence.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Absence, mourning, separation.$(br)  Can symbolize someone brilliant, but distant and unemotional.$(br)  In relation to a problem it calls for clear thinking and detachment.
$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Bigotry, deceit, emotional turmoil.$(br)  Sometimes signifies someone manipulative or even cruel.
